title: SHO energy - find minimum spring length

content.question: A block on a horizontal surface is attached to one end of a spring, and the other end of the spring is attached to a fixed wall, as shown in the figure. The block oscillates with negligible friction on the horizontal surface. When the spring length is <math alttext="0.28 meters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mn>0.28</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>m</mtext></mstyle></math>, the potential energy of the spring is zero, and the kinetic energy of the block is <math alttext="4.0 joules" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mn>4.0</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>J</mtext></mstyle></math>. A short time later, when the spring length is <math alttext="0.24 meters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.24</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>m</mtext></math>, the kinetic energy of the block is <math alttext="3.0 joules" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>3.0</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>J</mtext></math>. What is the minimum length of the spring during an oscillation cycle of the block?

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
